result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus A Mcgruther

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus A Mcgruther appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Marcus A Mcgruther.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

No driving without a valid license and Insurance.

Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered case to be scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing before Preliminary Court.
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.

Case calendared for  a Return on Warrant.
Defense in a different court and this court is in trial.
Court ordered case adjourned.
Return on warrant scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on  9-23-2022
Original  bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for  Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 19.
Parties notified via email  the  Return of Warrant is scheduled September 30, 2022 at 1:30pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW

Defendant Marcus A Mcgruther not in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marcus A Mcgruther.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that signature bond is forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brandon B.; Kimberly B.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No driving without a valid license and insurance. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marcus A Mcgruther appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marcus A Mcgruther.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
